intro: Eupatoriopsis, commonly known as false geranium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, often clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. They typically grow in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Eupatoriopsis species are native to the Americas, particularly the United States and parts of South America. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
